cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, forecast to slow and turn northwest then northeast across northern Florida and southeastern Georgia before emerging off the Georgia/South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend north-eastward across coastal Georgia and South Carolina into coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low (13%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday night into Friday; occasional gusts to 35–40 mph possible if the core passes near or just east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, but current guidance keeps storm surge below 3 ft for the Savannah area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with the cyclone could drop 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts should the center track directly over or east of the port Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls, lightning, and elevated seas/river levels may disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations during Friday.
